page.title: 03 SECONDARY SCHOOLS
page.content: The 2 main secondary schools of the area are Hazlehead and Summerhill Academies. Hazlehead was opened in 1970 to replace the former Aberdeen Academy in Belmont St. There are 1250 pupils and 128 staff. An area compre hensive school, the Academy caters for pupils up to S6. Summerhill Academy is also a 6 year comprehensive with 650 pupils. A special feature within the school is the Language unit teaching English as a second language to foreign children. Some 118 children from Japan, S. America, USSR and Vietnam have been given intensive English tuition in order to profit from their normal schooling. Both schools are extensively used by the community especially such leisure facilities as swimming pools, sports halls and gymnasia.
